description:
I love Jupyter Notebook. Really admire that piece of software. But this particual snap package is really bad. 

First of all it only has a python core, not even a terminal one. 

Then, when it starts up, it aslo opens up a browser navigated to a page like file:///run/user/1000/snap.jupyter/jupyter/nbserver-13130-open.html
But that just simply aint gonna work. The only how can you access it, is via http://localhost:xxxx/whatever

Lastly, given all its guts are inside of caged snap, it's a bit of challenge to get additional python packages installed "inside of it". And configuration is also troublesome. Some of the software just shouldn't be snapped like this.

Not sure if ppl who have packed Jupyter into this snap will be reading my review, but pls, equip yourself with someone, who actually knows Jupiter and let him package this into snap.

For all the rest folks, you wants to give a wonderful Jupyter Notebook a try, it's better to stay away from this SNAP package
summary: this particular package is less than mediocre

Khatarnak op op op .............

to save my notebook?? (Can't submit a one-star review either!)
Works perfectly as expected.
The jupyter notebook installed through snap expects to freshly install all required python packages inside notebook , even when it is already available.
summary: Doesnt support Already installed Python Packages

description:
fresh install and cells won't run. The issue has been well documented for over a year and there hasn't been any helpful action from the maintenance team. They just blame adblockers even though that's not the root cause for most of the people facing the issue. 

I stopped using Jupyter a couple years ago because of the constant issues, but thought I would give it another shot. Same experience, which I don't expect to change.

If you screwed up like I did then use a Sudoer or Wheel groupy and run this>     "  install --upgrade jupyter_client "  And it will make another attempt to install the files SEL blocked! 

 Works fine!
summary: Make sure you have permisions to install!

description: For those who are stuck, you need to run 'jupyter notebook' on the terminal to get it working.
Thank you for porting this program to the snap. Everything works perfectly.

I have tried several different ways to install jupyter, including this snap app, because I have as yet vague aspirations of using python to analyze computer output of card games and to display the results in charts, etc. But, I could only get so far in installing it, and then I couldn't get a notebook to even display again. Vanilla Javascript has my name on it.
it's seem dificult run, but it's run from new's icon in left main Jupyter window with creat a new python app or any other opthoins...
summary: Great app with user freindly interface

description: Overall great idea, but will require in-code configuration for libraries like numpy via import sys; sys.path.append("NumPy_path") (or update to environment variables).
summary: Remember to configure your libraries paths

description:
As of 1/2021, I suggest you search for Sage and install SageMath, which includes, and by default STARTS AS Jupyter Notebook. (Unlike on windows, where you have 3 "modes" to start, only one of which is JN. But I only ever use JN and linux is better so happy.)
FOSS often offers too many ways to skin a ... source. We love cats.

Jupyter Notebook is an open-source web application that allows you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations and narrative text. Uses include: data cleaning and transformation, numerical simulation, statistical modeling, data visualization, machine learning, and much more.
